alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 08 at 2:28AM EST until January 10 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...The District of Columbia. In Maryland, Charles County. In Virginia, Arlington/Falls Church/Alexandria, and Stafford, King George and Southeast Prince William Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Water is expected to cover yards and docks in Dahlgren and on Cobb Island. Water covers the approach to Cobb Island bridge and begins limiting the ability to reach the mainland. Also water approaches structures near Cobb Island. Shoreline inundation up to two feet above ground is possiblThe unprotected area on the Southwest Waterfront at the DC Seafood Market is expected to flood. Water is expected to approach parts of the Hains Point Loop Road, but it will likely be closed. Water is expected to approach buildings near King Street and Union Street.e elsewhere. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 4 feet above normal. The next high tide at Aquia Creek is at 3:41 AM and 3:53 PM. The next high tide at Goose Bay is at 1:13 PM and 1:52 AM. The next high tide at Alexandria is at 5:27 AM and 5:39 PM. The next high tide at Washington Channel is at 5:09 AM and 5:21 PM. The next high tide at Dahlgren is at 12:04 PM and 12:29 AM. The next high tide at Indian Head is at 4:55 AM and 5:07 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Upper Machodoc Creek at Dahlgren MLLW Categories - Minor 3.5 ft, Moderate 5.0 ft, Major 7.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.6 ft, Moderate 3.1 ft, Major 5.1 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/12 PM 2.2 0.3 0.7 0.5 None 09/01 AM 2.2 0.3 1.1 0.5 None 09/02 PM 3.6 1.7 2.2 2.0 Minor 10/01 AM 5.3 3.4 4.1 2.0 Moderate 10/01 PM 3.6 1.7 2.1 0.5 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
